Description:What Were Doing
As a part of the Lockheed Martin community, we take on challenges and find solutions using creativity and collaboration. If you’re looking to be a part of a passionate team solving these complex problems, then Rotary and Mission Systems is the place for you.

The Work
Lockheed Martin, located in Syracuse, NY, is in search of a motivated Sr Hardware Engineer to support advanced Radar Programs to meet the needs of our DOD and International customers.

Day-to-day workload will consist of direct support of program execution and/or proposal support across the portfolio of products and proposals. Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to:

• Responsible for the mechanical design of Radar system equipment including requirements decomposition, concept design, detailed design and analysis, design documentation, procurement support, manufacturing support, test support, and environmental testing
• Use engineering solid modeling tools to perform design tasks
• Lead engineering support of Factory Following
• Drive drafting, review, approval and release in EPDM with Hardware Engineering team
• Lead and coordinate the refinement, and execution of production improvement efforts
• Investigate technical issues with Radar components, determine root causes, create solutions and drive implementation
• Experience within the defense industry is a plus.

Candidates should have excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to work in an integrated product development team. Proficiency with the use of personal computers, including word processing and graphical applications is required. The successful candidate will be flexible, motivated, dedicated, detail-focused, team-oriented, and capable of multi-tasking.

Who We Are
Lockheed Martin is a global aerospace, defense, and security company dedicated to advancing scientific discovery and harnessing innovation to make the world a safer place. Our RMS business in Syracuse, NY is a hub of talented engineers, scientists, and professionals committed to shaping the future of defense technology. We value collaboration, excellence, and integrity in everything we do. As a part of our team, you will work alongside like-minded individuals dedicated to pushing the boundaries of whats possible.

Job Description:

What candidate will Be Doing:
• Drive and contribute to all stages of the Hardware Product Development Lifecycle, from concept to production.
• Design and develop hardware architectures based on microcontrollers including ST, Microchip, and Texas Instruments (TI).
• Create analog and mixed-signal circuit designs including ADC/DAC, signal conditioning, and discrete analog components.

The Sr Staff Hardware Engineer will define, develop and deliver production hardware in embedded environment for high performance computing platform for VW Group in order to create in-house development expertise for connected infotainment and ADAS/AD system. Job Description Summary

As a Hardware Engineer for Critical Infrastructure Communications (CIC) at GE Grid Solutions, you will be responsible for designing industry-leading solutions for industrial grade wired and wireless communications products. CIC is seeking an experienced Electrical Engineer who is team-oriented, can thrive in the critical path, and has a demonstrated track record of bringing a broad range of products from concept to production.A successful candidate will have practical circuit-level design and troubleshooting experience in a laboratory environment. The ideal candidate should have working knowledge at the product level, as the candidate will be responsible for various aspects of the design throughout the product lifecycle including production. This role requires strong written and verbal communication skills to accurately convey complex solutions to audiences of varying technical expertise on a cross-functional team spanning multiple sites.

About us:Grid Solutions, a GE Vernova business, serves customers globally with over 12,000 employees. We are focused on bringing together technologies and expertise to help solve the toughest power system challenges, accelerating the global transition to a more resilient and reliable grid. For more about GE’s Grid Solutions, visit https://www.gevernova.com/grid-solutions/.

Roles and Responsibilities:
• Contribute to the hardware development of industrial-grade communications equipment by applying principles and techniques of electrical engineering, circuit design, and analysis.
• Complete the analysis and design of digital and mixed-signal communications circuitry including MCU, CPU, flash, Ethernet, and USB considering EMC, thermal, mechanical, and electrical safety constraints.

• Create new components and maintain component database.
• Create production documentation including top level bills of material and label specifications.

• Ensure compliance to product safety, emissions, and performance standards supporting 3rd party certification labs as needed.
• Support and troubleshoot existing product design deficiencies reported by customers and manufacturing.
• Perform MTBF and reliability data for the individual product subsystems.
• Provide support and specifications to Manufacturing and Test Engineering teams.

Required Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree in Engineering with 3-5 years of prior hardware design experience and product development ideally in telecommunication products.
• Minimum of 5 years of experience with hardware design.
• Familiarity with emissions standards including FCC, IC, ETSI, Anatel, or ACMA.

• Experience with communication interfaces and protocols (ex. Ethernet, USB, I2C, SPI, etc).

• Ability to multi-task, prioritize tasks, and quickly adapt in a fast-paced engineering environment.

• Experience using signal generators, network analyzers, and spectrum analyzers.

We are seeking a Senior Electrical Engineer to join the Resilient Connectivity Products (RCP) Hardware Technologies Department in Mission Systems, where your work will directly shape how critical communication systems perform in the most demanding environments. In this role, you will help deliver innovative, mission-critical technology that enables defense customers to operate with confidence, resilience, and speed.

As a Senior Electrical Engineer on the RCP team, you will design and develop high-performance digital hardware used in communication products essential to the defense of our nation. These solutions support Ground, Airborne, and Space applications and require creativity, technical rigor, and a passion for solving complex challenges. This position is an onsite role located in El Segundo, California.

You can expect to work in a fast-paced, highly collaborative environment where engineers are encouraged to take ownership, contribute ideas, and push the boundaries of what’s possible. Individuals with strong initiative and technical curiosity will find ample opportunity to make an impact and grow.

What You will do
• Perform circuit card design lifecycle activities including requirements capture, schematic capture, design documentation, signal integrity analysis, creation of board stackup and routing instructions, coordination and review of printed wiring board layout, creation of test plans, root cause analysis, and integration. Designs will include the use of FPGA, processors, and DDR memory components, and industry interfaces, such as Ethernet, I2C, SPI, and UART. Generate Printed Wiring Board (PWB) layout constraint guidelines and oversee the routing, layout, fabrication, and assembly of complex designs.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software, firmware, and mechanical engineers, to develop proven hardware designs that meet system performance and operational specifications.
• Prepare and present project and/or technical information to technical staff, program leadership, management and customers. This includes producing technical documentation, including specifications, hardware design documents, and test plans.
• Test and troubleshoot electronic circuitry. Includes support lab of design verification testing for circuit card assemblies.
• Perform trade studies as needed and select components necessary to implement the requirements. Includes supporting system architecture discussions where needed.

What You will learn
• Develop deep expertise as a subject matter expert in high-speed digital circuit design, influencing design approaches and technical decisions across complex programs.
Strengthen your mastery of hardware electrical engineering principles through hands-on design, analysis, and problem-solving involving high-speed interfaces, processors, and field-programmable gate arrays (FPGAs).
• Expand your technical and leadership capabilities in a growing organization, with opportunities to progress toward advanced technical authority, broader system influence, or people leadership

Qualifications You Must Have
• Typically requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and minimum 5 years prior relevant experience or an Advanced Degree in a related field and minimum 3 years of experience
• Active and transferable U.S. government issued security clearance is required prior to start date. U.S. citizenship is required, as only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearance
• Experience with all aspects of circuit card design lifecycle activities including requirements capture, schematic capture, layout, build, and test as evidenced by successful design completion.
• Experience with schematic capture of electrical circuit designs. Includes familiarity with a schematic capture tool (examples may include Siemens/Mentor Graphics Xpedition, Altium, Cadence Allegro, EAGLE, KiCAD, etc.) for creation of circuit card designs.
• Experience with electrical designs that contain digital electronics such as processors, FPGAs, high-speed transceivers, DDR, and flash memories.

Qualifications We Prefer
• Experience with generating Printed Wiring Board (PWB) layout constraint guidelines and overseeing the routing, layout, fabrication, and assembly of the design.
• Experience with Agile for Hardware Development, including planning, tracking, and managing hardware development projects in JIRA is a plus.
• Familiar with latest technology trends in the area of high-speed digital design, as well as microprocessors, memory, FPGA and interface protocols.
• Signal integrity (SI) and power integrity (PI) experience with ability to perform pre- and post-layout simulations and analysis to ensure reliable signal transmission and power delivery for high-speed interfaces like PCIe, DDR, and high-speed Ethernet.
• Project management experience using Earned Value Management System (EVMS). Includes experience performing cost, schedule, and risk management for hardware development projects.

Elbit America is a leading provider of high-performance products, system solutions, and support services focusing on the defense, homeland security, commercial aviation, and medical instrumentation markets. (NASDAQ: ESLT and TASE: ESLT), a global high-technology company engaged in a wide range of programs for innovative defense and commercial applications. For additional information, visit: ElbitAmerica.com or follow us on YouTube.

Job Summary:
Elbit is currently seeking a Senior Electrical Engineer to join our team in Merrimack, NH. This position will research, plan, design, develop, analyze, and test a variety of electronic equipment and systems, including displays, sensors, processors, interface units, and other electronic devices, circuitry components, analog and digital electronics, and control and test equipment.
This role is focused on **board-level digital and mixed-signal hardware design**, including **processor and FPGA-based system integration**, and supports products from prototype through EMI qualification and production. The successful candidate will function effectively and communicate in a dynamic, integrated product team environment, supporting a variety of programs.

Responsibilities & Tasks:
• Responsible for carrying out specific project responsibilities as part of larger program objectives involved in the design and development of products, equipment, or processes
• May design and lay out items
• Consults with higher-level engineering personnel to resolve more complex design alternatives
• Utilize electronic design tools such as schematic capture
• Review and implement design for manufacturing (DFM) and design for test (DFT) objectives
• Develop specifications, schematics, assembly drawings, and bill of materials against which designs can be produced
• Prepares sub-system performance specifications
• Evaluate and select optimum design alternatives
• Determine design feasibility and ensure that product designs are competitive
• Provide directions to others who determine appropriate materials and processes for specific component applications
• Lead or conduct experiments to evaluate operating characteristics of products or processes, execute test and troubleshooting activities
• Evaluate engineering prototypes and translate experimental results into design criteria
• Conduct computer simulations to analyze, test, or design products
• Develop task inputs to engineering project plans and maintain liaison with other departments of the organization
• Respond to customer engineering queries and advise others on engineering information relevant to the organization's product capabilities
• Provide technical presentation support and consultation for marketing
• Represent the engineering unit in customer or field service contacts, troubleshoot customer application problems
• Utilize project planning and monitoring methods to ensure timely completion
• Assume responsibility for successful completion (Schedule, Performance, Cost) of systems and sub-systems
• Perform preliminary engineering necessary to confirm plans and programs
• Assist in assuring the technical soundness of engineering programs
• Support the manufacturing process in resolving design problems
• Collaborate with purchasing in obtaining quotations or bids and recommend the selection of vendors
• Prepare engineering specifications for major purchases
• Prepare reports of field tests, startups, or installations as required and write technical instructions
• On a project or on-going basis, supervise the work of other engineering personnel
• Contribute to process improvements
• Develop the total cost of ownership models for a complete system, based upon predicted reliability, operational usage, and environmental factors
• Recommend to Management to select appropriate and cost-efficient vendors
• Contribute to the development and improvement of packaging techniques to meet quality, function, and cost standards

• Bachelor’s degree in electrical or Electronic Engineering and at least 5 years of relevant experience in the industry (defense/government contractor experience preferred but not required)
• Experience with one of the following: Mentor Graphics, Cadence, and/or Altium
• Ability to travel 10%
• Ability to obtain a Secret Clearance
• Must be a U.S. Citizen

Required experience in one or more of the following areas:
• High-speed digital design – FPGA and Microprocessors

Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.

ABOUT THE TEAM

The Anduril Imaging team develops state-of-the-art imaging systems across both hardware and software, deployed to tackle the most significant security challenges of America and its allies. The team is heavily involved in utilizing computer vision, perception, electro-optical, infrared, and sensor data to give our war fighters and allies an advantage.

ABOUT THE JOB

As an Electrical Hardware Engineer at Anduril Imaging, you will design and develop advanced electronics for airborne EO/IR systems, focusing on sensor electronics, aircraft interfaces, and power management. Your role will involve hands-on testing and collaboration with cross-functional teams to ensure optimal performance and integration of cutting-edge technologies.

WHAT YOU’LL DO
• Contribute to the design, development, and testing of electronics for airborne EO/IR systems, including sensor electronics, aircraft interfaces, and power management.
• Support systems engineering teams in defining and refining requirements based on physics-based models of sensor and system performance.
• Assist in the design and development of PCB layouts in collaboration with the electrical engineering team.
• Participate in system testing at laboratory, ground, and flight test levels, providing detailed data analysis and feedback.
• Conduct troubleshooting and testing of electronic components and subsystems to ensure optimal performance.
• Work closely with technical leads and project teams to support system integration efforts.
• Document test results, system designs, and processes to maintain thorough technical records.

• 5+ years of experience in electrical engineering, focusing on system-level design, development, and testing.
• A degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent.
• Experience with analog and digital electronics design, testing, and troubleshooting.

• Eligible to obtain and maintain an active U.S. Secret security clearance

At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.

The Boeing Company is looking for an experienced Intelligence Systems Electrical Hardware Design Engineer (Associate or Mid-Level) to join the Electrostatically Supported Gyro Navigator (ESGN) Replacement team located in Huntington Beach, California.

This position will report to the Intelligence Systems Organization. The role will emphasize test and troubleshooting, as well as anomaly resolution of existing electrical/electronic hardware used in inertial navigation systems. Also, in addition to program sustainment work, there will be opportunities to support the Electronic Products center of excellence with future design work.

Position Responsibilities:
• Analyze customer and system requirements to support architectural approaches and detailed specifications for various electronic products
• Review, analyze, and translate customer requirements into the design of electrical hardware products and systems
• Test, debug, and integrate hardware into existing systems while meeting industry, customer, safety, and regulatory standards
• Integrate and troubleshoot hardware components with embedded software, FPGAs, IC chips, and discrete components
• Develop and maintain acceptance test procedures to support production
• Test, troubleshoot and provide rework statements of work to the Supplier
• Support obsolescence management
• Work within configuration management and procedure controls common to defense contracts
• Investigate emerging technologies to develop concepts for future product designs to meet projected requirements
• Provide support input to aid EMI compatibility, signal integrity, and power integrity analysis and simulation models
• Support the technical aspects of proposal preparation and project planning through schedule and budget estimations as well as make/buy recommendations

• 1+ years of experience in electrical hardware engineering development
• Familiarity with multilayer mixed-signal circuits, sensors (especially navigation sensors), analog/digital conversion, firmware/FPGA programming including VHDL, and the use of test equipment
• Experience with electronic analytic tools, Mentor graphics and performing product verification testing
• Experience managing supplier assemblies and requirements
• Demonstrated performance on development programs and the ability to resolve technical issues in complex environments
• Ability to prepare and present briefings covering technical aspects of the position

• Experience with Xilinx FPGA place/route tools

• Experience with analog circuits, power supplies, and EMI protection devices
• Experience in quality assurance and design validations

The Manager, Hardware Design Engineering manages cross functional teams with other designers, customers, manufacturing engineering and project leadership to ensure robust and high quality product development. + Analyzing and interpreting data and information

+ Creating reports and documentation

+ May manage relationships with key vendors/partners.
